setting.description: A sprawling, corrupt metropolis — part Los Santos, part Vice City. Neon-lit downtown towers owned by the Kuru Corporation sit above a gritty underworld of underground fight clubs, rigged casinos, and drug-running operations. The city runs on three currencies: money, loyalty, and fear.
setting.era: Modern day — smartphones, social media, CCTV everywhere, crypto, underground racing
setting.tone: Dark, morally grey, violent but with moments of unexpected philosophy. Think GTA V meets The Godfather meets a Scorsese film.

world_rules: Power is held through territory, business fronts, and political connections
The police are corrupt and can be bought — justice is DIY
Loyalty is the highest currency — betrayal is punished with death
Every character carries a weapon and a secret
Social media and surveillance create a panopticon — secrets don't stay hidden
Underground fight rings and street races serve as proving grounds
The city has five boroughs, each controlled by a different crew or family
Nightclubs, casinos, and chop shops are the key business fronts
genre_conventions: Missions and heists structure the narrative
Each major character has a signature vehicle and weapon
Radio stations and phone calls deliver exposition
Betrayal, revenge, and moral ambiguity drive the plot
Satirical take on capitalism, politics, and social media
Violence has consequences — heat from cops, rival gangs, media attention
Cutscenes between action sequences deliver emotional beats
The protagonist questions whether winning was worth the cost

aesthetic.visual: Neon nights, rain-soaked highways, penthouse views contrasted with gutter-level alleyways
aesthetic.audio: Hip-hop, Indian classical fusion, trap beats, philosophical monologues over drive sequences
aesthetic.mood: Stylish nihilism punctuated by genuine human connection
